SfdxErrorConfig

SfdxErrorConfig

A class to manage all the keys and tokens for a message bundle to use with SfdxError.

Constructor

new SfdxErrorConfig(packageName, bundleName, errorKey, errorTokens, actionKeyopt, actionTokensopt)

Create a new SfdxErrorConfig.

Example
SfdxError.create(new SfdxErrorConfig('MyPackage', 'apex', 'runTest').addAction('apexErrorAction1', [className]));
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
packageName string

The name of the package.
bundleName string

The message bundle.
errorKey string

The error message key.
errorTokens Tokens

The tokens to use when getting the error message.
actionKey string <optional>

The action message key.
actionTokens Tokens <optional>

The tokens to use when getting the action message(s).

Methods

addAction(actionKey, actionTokensopt) → {SfdxErrorConfig}

Add an error action to assist the user with a resolution.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
actionKey string

The action key in the message bundle.
actionTokens Tokens <optional>

The action tokens for the string.
Returns:

For convenience this object is returned.

Type
SfdxErrorConfig

getActions() → {Optional.<Array.<string>>}

Get the action messages using messages.getMessage.

Throws:

If errorMessages.load was not called first.

Type
SfdxError
Returns:

List of action messages.

Type
Optional.<Array.<string>>

getError() → {string}

Get the error message using messages.getMessage.

Throws:

If errorMessages.load was not called first.

Type
SfdxError
Returns:
Type
string

load() → {Messages}

Load the messages using Messages.loadMessages.

Returns:

Returns the loaded messages.

Type
Messages

removeActions() → {SfdxErrorConfig}

Remove all actions from this error config. Useful when reusing SfdxErrorConfig. for other error messages within the same bundle.

Returns:

For convenience this object is returned.

Type
SfdxErrorConfig

setErrorKey(key) → {SfdxErrorConfig}

Set the error key.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
key string

The key to set.
Returns:

For convenience this object is returned.

Type
SfdxErrorConfig

setErrorTokens(tokens) → {SfdxErrorConfig}

Set the error tokens.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
tokens Tokens

The tokens to set.
Returns:

For convenience this object is returned.

Type
SfdxErrorConfig
